link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From A003961
xref: Differs from A293442 for the first time at n=32, where a(32) = 18, while A293442(32) = 10.
